net.sf.appia.xml
Class AppiaXML

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.xml.AppiaXML

public class AppiaXML
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements methods to create channels using XML definitions in a File or String.

To better understand how this class works please refer to AppiaXML: A Brief Tutorial found in the Appia website.

Author:
Jose Mocito

Method Detail

getInstance

public static AppiaXML getInstance(Appia appia)
                            throws AppiaXMLException
Returns a new instance of AppiaXML associated with the given Appia instance. All channels created by the returned instance will belong to the Appia instanced given as argument.

Parameters:
appia - the Appia instance where channels will be created.
Returns:
a new AppiaXML instance.
Throws:
AppiaXMLException

load

public static void load(java.io.File xmlfile)
                 throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                        java.io.IOException
Loads the configuration in the xmlfile file.

Parameters:
xmlfile - the File where the configuration resides.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is an error during the parsing of the file. In that case, the thrown exception is wrapped inside the SAXException.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error accessing the file.

load

public static void load(java.io.File xmlfile,
                        Appia appia)
                 throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                        java.io.IOException
Loads the configuration in the xmlfile file.

Parameters:
xmlfile - the File where the configuration resides.
appia - the Appia instance where channels are created.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is an error during the parsing of the file. In that case, the thrown exception is wrapped inside the SAXException.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error accessing the file.

loadAndRun

public static void loadAndRun(java.io.File xmlfile)
                       throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                              java.io.IOException
Loads the configuration in the xmlfile file and "runs" Appia (calls Appia's run() method), initiating all channel activities.

Parameters:
xmlfile - the File where the configuration resides.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is an error during the parsing of the file. In that case, the thrown exception is wrapped inside the SAXException.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error accessing the file.

loadAndRun

public static void loadAndRun(java.lang.String xmlstr)
                       throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                              java.io.IOException
Loads the configuration in the xmlstr string and "runs" Appia (calls Appia's run() method), initiating all channels activities.

Parameters:
xmlstr - the String containing the XML description.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is an error during the parsing of the string. In that case, the thrown exception is wrapped inside the SAXException.
java.io.IOException - if there is an error accessing the string.

createChannel

public static Channel createChannel(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String templateName,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    ChannelProperties params,
                                    boolean initialized,
                                    MemoryManager mm,
                                    java.lang.String messageFactory)
                             throws AppiaException
Creates a channel based on a chosen template with the given parameters.

Parameters:
name - the channel name.
templateName - the template name.
label - the String label associated with the channel.
params - the parameters to be passed to their respective sessions.
initialized - whether or not the channel is returned initialized.
mm - the memory manager of the channel
Returns:
the Channel created.
Throws:
AppiaException - when Appia cannot create the channel.
See Also:
ChannelProperties
